solution_line_template: On Sunday he takes {sunday_time_hours} hours to get there because {store_distance} / {walking_speed} = <<{store_distance}/{walking_speed}={sunday_time_hours}>>{sunday_time_hours}
This takes him {sunday_time_minutes} minutes because {sunday_time_hours} x {minutes_per_hour} = <<{sunday_time_hours}*{minutes_per_hour}={sunday_time_minutes}>>{sunday_time_minutes}

On Tuesday and Thursday, it takes him {weekday_time_hours} hours to get to the store because {store_distance} / {running_speed} = <<{store_distance}/{running_speed}={weekday_time_hours}>>{weekday_time_hours}

On Tuesday and Thursday, it takes him {weekday_time_minutes} minutes to get to the store because {weekday_time_hours} x {minutes_per_hour} = <<{weekday_time_hours}*{minutes_per_hour}={weekday_time_minutes}>>{weekday_time_minutes}

In total it takes him {total_time_minutes} minutes to get to the store because {sunday_time_minutes} + {weekday_time_minutes} + {weekday_time_minutes} = <<{sunday_time_minutes}+{weekday_time_minutes}+{weekday_time_minutes}={total_time_minutes}>>{total_time_minutes}
On average it takes him {average_time_minutes} minutes because {total_time_minutes} / {num_trips} = <<{total_time_minutes}/{num_trips}={average_time_minutes}>>{average_time_minutes}
